timeline.content: This was for Discord Staff (and their personal accounts), Partners, Verified Server Owners, and some server owners with a certain threshold revenue. There is not much information for begun or completed times.

content: Begun at ... with May 2015.
Completed at ... with February 2016 (Nitro) and August 2015 (Non-Nitro).
Begun at ... with March 2016 (Nitro) and September 2015 (Non-Nitro).
Completed at ... with October 2016 (Nitro) and October 2015 (Non-Nitro).
Begun at ... with January 2017 (Nitro) and November 2015 (Non-Nitro).
At ..., there was multiple confirmed reports of February 2017 (Nitro).
At ..., there was multiple confirmed reports of up to November 2017 (Nitro) and December 2015 (Non-Nitro).
At ..., there was multiple confirmed reports of up to January 2016 (Non-Nitro).
Completed at ... with November 2017 (Nitro) and January 2016 (Non-Nitro).

timeline.content: Waiting for this to happen! This should be by <c-timestamp unix="1686247200">...</c-timestamp>!

faq.header: When will I get my username?
content: There is no official timeline. This is to only provide a overview of what is going on currently.
Confirmed as of <c-timestamp unix="1686163919">...</c-timestamp>, they seem to be in two waves: one at or before 2:00 PM Eastern Time (GMT-4) and another at or before 8:00 PM Eastern Time (GMT-4).

faq.header: I'm in the correct category and timeframe and should have the "rollout", but I don't?!
content: Don't be alarmed! It seems a lot of people are experiencing this issue!
No one really knows the root cause of it, however here are some tips:
-> Try logging out and logging back in
-> Try cold restarting Discord
-> Make sure you're up-to-date with the Discord client you're using.
-> As the rollout seems to be gradually rolling out, you can try waiting up to 24-48 hours.

If you've tried everything and still cannot get this blasted thing, you can try reaching out to Discord: https://dis.gd/contact. This seems to be not possible if you are able to claim but it won't work...
There's not much you can do at this time otherwise...

faq.header: There are users who have it way after the date you list!
content: It may be possible, if one of the two conditions applies:

-> The user was apart of Rollout 0, which rolled the new system out for Discord Staff (and their personal accounts), Partners, Verified Server Owners, and some server owners with a certain threshold revenue.
-> The information provided here is somehow out of date. To avoid misinformation as much as possible, it may take a bit to update this page.

faq.header: How do I learn more about this change?
I want to report an issue / report a update / talk to you / etc...
faq.content: You can reach out to me via Discord at @thecodingguy.

faq.header: How often does this page update?
faq.content: The page reloads every 5 minutes (to save bandwidth, as well). This page will be updated carefully to avoid misinformation as much as possible.
Unless it shows up with something like (GMT-4), it's in your local timezone.

content: Short answer: No, but it is as much as we have, as a community.

Long answer: No, this is not in any way, shape, or form an official tracker. The content maybe inaccurate (although at its best, I try to keep it accurate!). Because it is a community effort, the data collected to present on this page varies for sources, but mainly from the Discord Admins server.
Discord will only consider you a "Nitro User" as long as you had Nitro before March 1st, 2023 AND continue to keep it until you receive the change.
It seems that if you get your Nitro back within the grace period (typically around 3 days), you should be able to fall into the "Nitro User" category.
Lastly, you will only fall into the "Nitro User" category if all applies AND your Nitro is NOT Nitro Basic (Nitro Classic will be honored, if you're wondering).
